heading: 2 Project Structure
text: Data Team uses variety technologies, mainly R ecosystem, create data projects. project similar file structure maintain consistency replicability across projects:’s important note outset data inside projects. project versioned git hosted TIES’ GitHub organization page. data sensitive degree, operational practice load data directly via APIs read NYU Box.Project templates can created internal tool dtproj.
code:
.github/         # All Github configuration [optional]
  workflows/     # All CI workflow definition files [optional]
blueprints/      # Contains all "blueprints" of datasets
codebooks/       # Contains exported codebooks of select datasets, depending on blueprint definition
config/
  environment.R  # Definitions of all environment variables used in this project
  packages.R     # Any `library()` for packages to be available across the project
R/               # All definitions for custom functions employed in the pipeline
.Rprofile        # Supplemental file that primarily sets up `renv`
_targets.R       # The main workflow orchestration definition file
renv.lock        # Package dependency state capture file for `renv`

heading: 2.1 blueprints
text: Data Team uses blueprintr package build, test, document datasets. blueprintr akin dbt, designed manage whole host metadata, necessary task dissemination project findings data publication. Moreover, blueprintr operates without connection data warehouse, given assumptions low connectivity technical availability Data Team operates .blueprint pair two files:blueprint definition file: R script single blueprint() command. file details generate desired dataset optionally includes arbitrary metadata dataset/table level.blueprint metadata file: CSV file , minimum, columns name, type, description. file enumerates variable-level metadata.example blueprint definition file:example metadata CSV blueprint:
code:
blueprint(
  "ch_scales",
  description = "Self-Regulation & Self-Regulated Learning",
  command =
    .TARGET("verified_child_data") %>%
      select(
        unique_id,
        c_id_01,
        starts_with("c_sr_"),
        starts_with("c_srl_")
      ) %>%
      shorten_domain_prefixes() %>%
      enumerator_regulation_score() %>%
      basic_number_renaming() %>%
      drop_underscore_in_vars(
        c("sr", "srl"),
        "^.*{var}_(\\d+)r?$"
      )
)

heading: 2.2 codebooks
text: “Codebooks” essentially data dictionaries, targeted social science research. commonly include enumerations variables dataset, well descriptions (applicable) categorical codings. codebooks also include methodology descriptions descriptive statistics data.codebooks folder contains HTML codebook exports selected blueprints, indicated presence blueprintr::bp_export_codebook() blueprint definition file:Unless otherwise agreed upon, codebooks internal purposes . mainly present support TIES’ members research.
code:
blueprint(
  "ch_scales",
  description = "Self-Regulation & Self-Regulated Learning",
  command =
    some_command()
) |>
  bp_export_codebook()

heading: 2.3 config
text: config folder two main R files:environment.Rpackages.ROther project-specific files, like YAML configuration, may stored folder.

heading: 2.3.1 environment.R
text: Sensitive information necessary pipeline function, like API keys passwords, must stored environment variables never checked version control. Environment variables generally stored personal .Renviron file, practice load global variables start pipeline avoid unnecessary calls Sys.getenv().example environment.R:
code:
BOX_PATH <- Sys.getenv("BOX_PATH", unset = NULL)
F_RUN_TESTS <- as.logical(Sys.getenv("F_RUN_TESTS", unset = "FALSE"))
F_NIGHTLY <- as.logical(Sys.getenv("F_NIGHTLY", unset = "FALSE"))

CACHE_PASSPHRASE <- Sys.getenv("CACHE_PASSPHRASE", unset = NULL)

heading: 2.3.2 packages.R
text: file serves two purposes:Capture soft dependencies project code (.e. packages required directly referred code)Attach packages via library() make packages’ exported functions available across entire pipelineOur project structure uses renv manage specific versions packages employed pipeline improve replicability. renv able capture dependencies via code inspection; however sometimes soft dependency (one explicitly stated code) can occur e.g. package depends another plotting routine. capture dependecies, place reference one package’s functions packages.R renv can treat package hard dependency.Use library() restricted packages used extensively. stated 3.2.1, preferred use package::func() syntax function writing; moreover, preferred style throughout pipeline definition well clarity long-term maintenance.Example packages.R:
code:
# Retain suggested packages in renv
labelled::to_labelled
kableExtra::kable_as_image
styler::style_dir # Format-on-save capability in VSCode
languageserver::run # Necessary for VSCode to work in renv projects

# Attach packages used in the entire pipeline here
library(targets)
library(tarchetypes)
library(tidytable)
library(blueprintr)
library(rcoder)

heading: 3.1.1 Object names
text: Adhere snake_case names variables. Use concise yet informative names – can difficult! dots common base R names (see .na()), please refrain using dot.case since dots syntactic meaning defining S3 generic methods.global constants variables referring environment variables, use UPPER_CASE_SNAKE_CASE. signify variables modified runtime. can create “locked bindings”, naming style immediately conveys intention.

# Chaos

heading: 7.3.1 Complete datasets
text: Datasets may published embargoed format repository. may necessary fulfill funder agreements. cases, repository codebook metadata outline details embargo, including end date. datasets also completed metadata licensed appropriate Creative Commons license.sample DDI codeBook embargo entire dataset. rely heavily dataAccs useStmt elements child elements stdyDscr. also recommended include contact element ,verStmt. elements citation branches. setting ID attributes dataAccs elements can link directly affected var varGrp elements using acces attribute.
code:
<codeBook>
  <stdyDscr>
    <citation>
      <titlStmt>
        <titl>Sample codebook</titl>
      </titlStmt>
    </citation>
    <dataAccs>
      <setAvail>
        <avlStatus ID="s_a_1">This dataset is currently under embargo until YYYY-MM-DD.</avlStatus>
        <complete ID="c1">Due to embargo provisions, data values for some variables have been masked. Users should consult the data definition statements to see which variables are under embargo. A new version of the collection will be released after embargoes are lifted.</complete>
        <notes>Insert other notes here</note>
      </setAvail>
      <useStmt>
        <conditions>The dataset is embargoed. Potential users of this dataset are advised to contact the PI...<conditions>
        <restrctn>For access or use restrictions. Specify types of users if use is restricted to or for those types.</restrctn>
        <specPerm ID="sp1" required="yes" formNo="ABC123" url = "https://www.form.xyz/ABC123">Users may apply to access this dataset before the embargo ends by filling out an access application and a confidentiality  agreement with Global TIES for Children</specPerm>
      </useStmt>
  </stdyDscr>

heading: 10.2.1 Bibliometric Terms
text: H-Index: author metric matches times article cited number articles author published. ’s slew adaptations H-Index well Google Scholar’s I10 Index (number articles cited 10 times).Times cited: number times article cited peer reviewed articles within databaseJournal Impact Factor: ratio number times articles journal cited number citable articles.Immediacy index: average number times journal article cited year published.

heading: 10.2.2 Altmetrics

heading: 10.3 Data Visualization
text: Data visualizations, practice using charts, graphs plots transmit information data, one services Data Team can provide TIES staff.Data visualization allows staff use visual storytelling, making complex analytic informational points dataset easier accessible format. Unlike text, visualizations clearer direct points data.Typically, data team build visualizations using R package ggplot2.

heading: 10.3.1 Types of data visualization
text: four general types data visualizations.Comparative: Compares two different sets data (either two different datasets, two subsets dame datasets, even two different research questions)Compositional: Describes parts whole datasetDistributional: Shows possible values dataset occur instance spaceRelational: variables dataset influence one another

text: loosely organized model defines relationships data, information, knowledge, wisdom. pyramid, data series raw observations, stimuli, symbols refined information. Information data interrogated made useful. processed data meaning purpose. Next knowledge. Knowledge synthesis information time multiple sources combined contextual information experience. Finally comes wisdom implicit knowledge based experience applying knowledge different situations. Wisdom allows user ask answer use information knowledge certain way without apparent thought.

heading: 10.42 Repositories
text: digital storage space researchers research organizations deposit datasets derived data objects associated research.Social Science Research Data RepositoriesDataverse: open source repository maintains collections https://schema.org/’s schemas.Inter-university Consortium Political Social Research (ICPSR): oldest social science repository, established 1962, hosted Institute Social Research University Michigan.Qualitative Data Repository (QDR): Dataverse instance dedicated archiving preserving data generated qualitative research methods. project hosted Center Qualitative Multi-Method Inquiry Syracuse University.Research Lifecycle RepositoriesDryad: international open-access research data repository complete, re-usable, open datasets. datasets licensed CC0 (Creative Commons Zero) waiver. submission fee.figshare: repository designed derived data objects research outputs. figshare accepts data format making flexible repositories.Open Science Framework (OSF): open platform designed manage data throughout lifecycle enable collaboration. OSF hosts number services including preprints, preregistrations, meeting conference support. also offers useful integrations repositories systems.Zenodo: general-purpose open-access repository operated CERN. Allows deposit research papers, datasets research software.Code RepositoriesGithub: Repository software development version control using git. ’s ability assign DOI Zenodo Github. Owned Microsoft.Gitlab: software development platform version control system using git designed set collaboration tools code repository. Gitlab built continuous integration/continuous delivery (CI/CD) DevOps features.Bitbucket: software development platform version control system using git designed teams. product Atlassian, owners Trello, Confluence, Jira, Sourcetree.Domain Specific RepositoriesHumanitarian Data eXchange (HDX): repository hosts international humanitarian data. repository hosted Center Humanitarian Data United Nations Office Coordination Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA). necessarily research data repository, HDX allows metadata records.Institutional RepositoriesNYU Faculty Digital Archive: Repository NYU faculty scholarship.
